title: Verifying the Scatterplot's Pattern
text: Using the STAT then EDIT menu on a graphing utility, list the years using values $$1-12$$ in L1 and the corresponding life expectancy in L2. Then use the STATPLOT feature to verify that the scatterplot follows a logarithmic pattern as shown in the attached figure.\n##figure1.gif##
speech: Using the STAT then EDIT menu on a graphing utility, list the years using values  1 minus 12,  in L1 and the corresponding life expectancy in L2. Then use the STATPLOT feature to verify that the scatterplot follows a logarithmic pattern as shown in the attached figure.\n##figure1.gif##
pacedSpeech: Using the STAT then EDIT menu on a graphing utility, list the years using values   1 minus 12,
in L1 and the corresponding life expectancy in L2. Then use the STATPLOT feature to verify that the scatterplot follows a logarithmic pattern as shown in the attached figure.##figure1.gif##

title: Using LnReg on the Calculator
text: Use the “LnReg” command from the STAT then CALC menu to obtain the logarithmic model, $$y=42.52722583+13.85752327\ln(x)$$.
speech: Use the “LnReg” command from the STAT then CALC menu to obtain the logarithmic model,  y is equal to 42.52722583 plus, 13.85752327 the natural log of, x .
pacedSpeech: Use the “LnReg” command from the STAT then CALC menu to obtain the logarithmic model,   y is equal to 42.52722583 plus, 13.85752327 the natural log of, x
